canonical_explanation.text: 3D shapes are solid shapes that take up space. They are not flat like 2D shapes. The five basic 3D shapes are sphere (like a ball), cube (like a dice), cuboid (like a brick or box), cone (like an ice cream cone), and cylinder (like a tin can). Some 3D shapes can roll because they have curved surfaces, like a sphere and a cylinder. Some shapes slide because they have flat faces, like a cube and a cuboid. 3D shapes have faces (flat parts), edges (where two faces meet), and vertices (corners).
rules: A sphere is round like a ball and can roll in all directions.
A cube has all equal square faces, like a dice.
A cuboid has rectangular faces, like a brick or a box.
A cone has a pointed top and a round base, like an ice cream cone.
A cylinder is like a tube with two round ends, like a tin can.
Shapes with curved surfaces can roll.
Shapes with flat faces can slide.
Faces are the flat parts of a 3D shape.
Edges are the lines where two faces meet.
Vertices are the corners of a 3D shape.
3D shapes are solid and take up space, while 2D shapes are flat.

questions.question_text: What shape is a ball?
questions.explanation_correct: A ball is a sphere, which is a 3D shape. A sphere is round and has a curved surface, just like a ball. So the correct answer is B) Sphere.
questions.explanation_incorrect: A cube is a 3D shape that has 6 flat square faces. A cone is a 3D shape that has a circular base and a pointed top. A cylinder is a 3D shape that has two circular bases and a curved surface in between. None of these shapes are the same as a ball, which is a sphere.

questions.question_text: What shape is a dice?
questions.explanation_correct: A dice is a cube shape. It has 6 flat faces, 12 edges, and 8 corners or vertices. This makes it a cube, which is one of the basic 3D shapes.
questions.explanation_incorrect: A sphere is a round 3D shape, like a ball. A cylinder is a 3D shape with flat circular bases and a curved surface in between, like a tin can. A cone has a circular base and a pointed top. But a dice is a cube, which is a 3D shape with 6 flat square faces and sharp corners.

questions.question_text: What shape is an ice cream cone?
questions.explanation_correct: An ice cream cone is shaped like a cone, which is one of the 5 basic 3D shapes. A cone has a curved surface and a flat base, just like an ice cream cone.
questions.explanation_incorrect: An ice cream cone is not a cube, which is a 3D shape with 6 flat square faces. It is also not a cuboid, which is a 3D shape with 6 flat rectangular faces. And it is not a cylinder, which is a 3D shape with 2 flat circular bases and a curved surface in between. The correct shape for an ice cream cone is a cone, which has a curved surface and a flat base.

questions.question_text: Which real object looks like a cylinder?
questions.explanation_correct: A tin can looks like a cylinder because it has a round, curved surface and a flat top and bottom. Cylinders are 3D shapes with curved sides and flat ends, just like a tin can.
questions.explanation_incorrect: A football does not look like a cylinder because it is an oval shape, not a round shape. A dice is a cube, which is a 3D shape with flat faces, not curved sides like a cylinder. A party hat is a cone shape, which is pointy at the top, not flat like a cylinder.

questions.question_text: Which shape can roll in all directions?
questions.explanation_correct: The sphere can roll in all directions because it has a curved surface that allows it to smoothly move around. A sphere is the only 3D shape that can roll in any direction.
questions.explanation_incorrect: The cube and cuboid cannot roll in all directions because they have flat faces. The cone can only roll in one direction because it has a pointed tip. The sphere is the only 3D shape that can roll in all directions because it has a curved surface that allows it to move freely in any direction.

questions.question_text: You place a cube on a flat table. What will it do?

options.text: It will stay still and slide if pushed
It will spin like a top

questions.explanation_correct: The cube will stay still and slide if you push it because cubes have flat faces that slide on the flat table. Cubes don't have curved surfaces that allow them to roll away.
questions.explanation_incorrect: The cube will not roll away because it has flat faces, not curved surfaces like a ball or a tin can. It also will not bounce up and down like a ball, or spin like a top, because it is a solid shape that sits flat on the table.

questions.question_text: Which of these things in your house is shaped like a cuboid?
questions.explanation_correct: A brick is shaped like a cuboid, which has flat faces and straight edges. This makes it different from a sphere (like a cricket ball) or a marble, which are round shapes.
questions.explanation_incorrect: A birthday cap is not a cuboid shape. It is more like a cone, with a curved surface and a pointy top. A cuboid has flat, rectangular faces and straight edges, like a brick or a box.

questions.question_text: How is a sphere different from a circle?

options.text: A sphere is flat, a circle is not
A sphere is solid and round, a circle is flat and round
A circle is bigger than a sphere

questions.explanation_correct: A sphere is a solid, round 3D shape, while a circle is a flat, 2D shape. Spheres take up space and have a curved surface, but circles are flat and do not have depth.
questions.explanation_incorrect: A sphere is a 3D shape that is solid and round, while a circle is a 2D shape that is flat and round. Spheres have depth and volume, but circles are flat and do not take up space. They are not the same thing - a sphere is a 3D shape, while a circle is a 2D shape.

questions.question_text: What do we call the flat parts of a 3D shape?
questions.explanation_correct: The flat parts of a 3D shape are called 'faces'. Faces are the flat surfaces that make up the shape.
questions.explanation_incorrect: The flat parts of a 3D shape are not called edges or vertices. Edges are the lines where the faces meet, and vertices are the corners of the shape. The correct term for the flat parts is 'faces'.

questions.question_text: Riya has a shape with two round flat ends and a curved side. What shape does she have?
questions.explanation_correct: The shape Riya has is a cylinder. A cylinder has two round flat ends and a curved side, just like the description given.
questions.explanation_incorrect: The other options are not the correct shape. A sphere is a round ball shape. A cone has a round base and a pointed top. A cube has six flat square sides. The shape described is a cylinder, which has two round flat ends and a curved side.

questions.question_text: A square is flat. Which 3D shape has square faces?
questions.explanation_correct: The cube is the 3D shape that has square faces. The cube has 6 square faces, 12 edges, and 8 vertices, making it a 3D shape with flat square faces.
questions.explanation_incorrect: The sphere is a round, ball-like 3D shape that does not have any square faces. The cone and the cylinder also do not have square faces. The cube is the 3D shape that has 6 square faces, making it the correct answer.

questions.question_text: Which shape will roll down a ramp?
questions.explanation_correct: The cylinder will roll down a ramp because it has a curved surface, like a ball. The cube and cuboid have flat faces, so they will just slide down instead of rolling.
questions.explanation_incorrect: The cube and cuboid have flat faces, so they will just slide down the ramp instead of rolling. The cylinder has a curved surface, so it can roll down the ramp easily. Only the cylinder out of these 3D shapes will roll down the ramp.

questions.question_text: Which of these is shaped like a sphere?
questions.explanation_correct: A watermelon is shaped like a sphere because it is a round, ball-like shape. Spheres are one of the basic 3D shapes that take up space in all directions.
questions.explanation_incorrect: A book is not shaped like a sphere because it has flat covers and pages, not a round, ball-like shape. A pencil box and a glass also do not have the round, ball-like shape of a sphere. Only a watermelon has the spherical shape of a 3D sphere.

questions.question_text: What do we call the corners of a 3D shape?
questions.explanation_correct: The corners of a 3D shape are called vertices. Vertices are the points where the edges of the shape meet, like the corners of a cube or a pyramid.
questions.explanation_incorrect: The corners of a 3D shape are not called faces or edges. Faces are the flat parts of the shape, and edges are where the faces meet. The correct answer is vertices, which are the corners or points of the 3D shape.

questions.question_text: Aman has a shape with a pointed top and a round bottom. What shape is it?
questions.explanation_correct: The shape with a pointed top and a round bottom is a cone. Cones have a circular base and a pointed tip, which matches the description of the shape Aman has.
questions.explanation_incorrect: The shape is not a sphere, which is a round ball shape. It is also not a cube, which is a square box shape, or a cuboid, which is a rectangular box shape. The pointed top and round bottom match the description of a cone, which is a 3D shape that looks like an ice cream cone.

questions.question_text: A ball is shaped like a ___.
questions.explanation_correct: A ball is shaped like a sphere because it is round and has no flat sides. Spheres are one of the basic 3D shapes, and they can roll because they have a curved surface.
questions.explanation_incorrect: The correct answer is 'sphere'. A sphere is a 3D shape that is round like a ball. It is not flat like a 2D shape. Spheres can roll because they have a curved surface, unlike shapes with flat sides like cubes or cuboids.

questions.question_text: A dice is shaped like a ___.
questions.explanation_correct: A dice is shaped like a cube because it has 6 flat square faces, just like a cube. A cube is a 3D shape that has equal sides and right angles, which is the same as a dice.
questions.explanation_incorrect: The answer is a cube. A dice is not shaped like a sphere, which is a round 3D shape. It is also not shaped like a cone, which has a curved side and a flat base. The dice has 6 flat square faces, just like a cube, so the correct 3D shape for a dice is a cube.

questions.question_text: A shape with flat faces will ___ when pushed on a table.
questions.explanation_correct: A shape with flat faces, like a cube or cuboid, will slide when you push it on a table. This is because the flat faces allow the shape to easily slide across the flat table surface.
questions.explanation_incorrect: The correct answer is 'slide'. A shape with flat faces, like a cube or cuboid, will slide when you push it on a table. This is because the flat faces allow the shape to easily slide across the flat table surface. The other option, 'roll', is for shapes with curved surfaces, like a sphere or cylinder, which can roll when pushed on a table.

questions.question_text: A sphere can ___ in all directions.
questions.explanation_correct: A sphere can roll in all directions because it has a curved surface. The curved shape allows the sphere to easily move and turn as it rolls across a surface.
questions.explanation_incorrect: The correct answer is 'roll'. A sphere cannot slide because it does not have any flat faces. The sphere's curved shape allows it to roll easily in any direction. This is why a sphere is different from shapes like cubes or cuboids, which can slide since they have flat surfaces.

questions.question_text: A tin can is shaped like a ___.
questions.explanation_correct: A tin can is shaped like a cylinder because it has a round curved surface, like a tin can or a can of soda. A cylinder is one of the basic 3D shapes, and it has a circular base and a circular top.
questions.explanation_incorrect: The correct answer is 'cylinder'. A cylinder is a 3D shape that has a circular base and a circular top, like a tin can. It is not a cube, which is a 3D shape with flat square faces. It is also not a sphere, which is a round 3D shape like a ball. The tin can has a curved surface, so it is a cylinder.

questions.question_text: The flat parts of a 3D shape are called ___.
questions.explanation_correct: The flat parts of a 3D shape are called faces. This is because the faces are the flat surfaces that make up the 3D shape, like the sides of a cube or the front and back of a box.
questions.explanation_incorrect: The flat parts of a 3D shape are not called edges or vertices. The flat surfaces that make up a 3D shape are called faces. For example, a cube has 6 flat faces, a cylinder has 2 flat faces, and a cone has 1 flat face.

questions.question_text: A circle is flat, but a ___ is round and solid.
questions.explanation_correct: A sphere is a 3D shape that is round and solid, unlike a flat circle which is a 2D shape. Spheres take up space and can roll around, while circles are flat and cannot roll.
questions.explanation_incorrect: The answer is 'sphere'. A sphere is a 3D shape that is round and solid, like a ball. It is not flat like a circle, which is a 2D shape. Spheres are different from circles because they take up space and can roll around, while circles are flat and cannot roll.

questions.question_text: A shoe box is shaped like a ___.
questions.explanation_correct: A shoe box is shaped like a cuboid because it has 6 flat faces, just like a rectangular box. A cuboid is a 3D shape that has the shape of a box.
questions.explanation_incorrect: The correct answer is cuboid. A cuboid is a 3D shape that has the shape of a rectangular box, like a shoe box. It has 6 flat faces, 12 edges, and 8 corners or vertices. A shoe box is not shaped like a cube, cone, cylinder, or sphere, so the correct answer is cuboid.

questions.question_text: A birthday cap (party hat) is shaped like a ___.
questions.explanation_correct: A birthday cap (party hat) is shaped like a cone because it has a curved, pointed top, just like the shape of a cone. Cones have a round base and a pointed top, which is the same shape as a birthday cap.
questions.explanation_incorrect: The birthday cap is not shaped like a cube, cuboid, sphere, or cylinder. Those are different 3D shapes. The correct 3D shape that matches the birthday cap is a cone, which has a round base and a pointed top.

questions.question_text: A rectangle is a flat shape, but a ___ is a solid shape with rectangular faces.
questions.explanation_correct: A cuboid is a 3D shape that has rectangular faces, like a box or a brick. It is a solid shape that takes up space, unlike a flat rectangle which is a 2D shape.
questions.explanation_incorrect: The correct answer is cuboid. A cuboid is a 3D shape with rectangular faces, like a box or a brick. It is a solid shape that takes up space, unlike a rectangle which is a flat 2D shape. So the answer that fits the blank is cuboid.

questions.question_text: A sphere is shaped like a ball.
questions.explanation_correct: A sphere is shaped like a ball because it is a round, 3D shape with a curved surface. Balls are the best example of a sphere, so the statement is true.
questions.explanation_incorrect: A sphere is not a flat, 2D shape. It is a 3D shape that takes up space and has a curved surface, just like a ball. The statement is true because a sphere is indeed shaped like a ball.

questions.question_text: A cone has two pointed ends.
questions.explanation_correct: A cone has one pointed end and one flat base. It does not have two pointed ends.
questions.explanation_incorrect: A cone has one pointed end and one flat base. Many students think a cone has two pointed ends, but that is not correct. The cone shape has only one pointed tip and one flat circular base.

questions.question_text: A cube can roll on a flat surface.
questions.explanation_correct: A cube cannot roll on a flat surface because it has flat faces, not curved surfaces. Cubes just slide on a flat surface, they don't roll.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Cubes have flat faces, not curved surfaces. This means that cubes cannot roll on a flat surface. They can only slide. Shapes that can roll, like spheres and cylinders, have curved surfaces that allow them to roll.

questions.question_text: A cylinder can roll.
questions.explanation_correct: Yes, a cylinder can roll because it has a curved surface. When you roll a cylinder, it spins around its curved surface and moves across the floor.
questions.explanation_incorrect: No, a cylinder cannot roll. A cylinder has flat circular faces on the top and bottom, and a curved surface in the middle. Because it has both flat and curved parts, a cylinder would not be able to roll smoothly across the floor like a sphere or a cylinder can.

questions.question_text: A cricket ball is shaped like a cube.
questions.explanation_correct: A cricket ball is not a cube. A cube has 6 flat square faces, but a cricket ball is round and has a curved surface. It is shaped like a sphere, not a cube.
questions.explanation_incorrect: A cricket ball is not shaped like a cube. A cube has 6 flat square faces, while a cricket ball is round and has a curved surface. Cubes are solid shapes with flat faces, but a cricket ball is a sphere, which is a 3D shape with a curved surface that can roll.

questions.question_text: A 3D shape is flat like a drawing on paper.
questions.explanation_correct: A 3D shape is not flat like a drawing on paper. 3D shapes are solid objects that take up space and have thickness, unlike 2D shapes which are flat.
questions.explanation_incorrect: A 3D shape is not flat like a drawing on paper. 3D shapes are solid objects that have three dimensions - length, width, and height. They are not flat like a 2D shape on a piece of paper. 3D shapes have thickness and take up space.

questions.question_text: A cube has flat faces.
questions.explanation_correct: Yes, a cube has flat faces. All the sides of a cube are flat, square-shaped surfaces. This makes the cube a 3D shape with six flat faces.
questions.explanation_incorrect: No, a cube does not have curved or round faces. It has six flat, square-shaped faces. The flat faces are what make a cube a 3D shape, unlike 2D shapes which are flat.

questions.question_text: A pipe is shaped like a cylinder.
questions.explanation_correct: A pipe is shaped like a cylinder because it has a curved surface, just like a tin can. Cylinders are one of the basic 3D shapes, and they are perfect for making pipes and other round objects.
questions.explanation_incorrect: A pipe is not shaped like a cube or a cuboid, which are 3D shapes with flat faces. It is shaped like a cylinder, which has a curved surface and can roll or slide easily. Cylinders are used to make many round objects, like tin cans and pipes.

questions.question_text: If you put a ball on a slope, it will slide and not roll.
questions.explanation_correct: A ball will roll down the slope because it has a curved surface. The curved shape allows the ball to roll smoothly instead of just sliding down.
questions.explanation_incorrect: The statement is false. A ball has a curved surface, so it will roll down a slope instead of sliding. Shapes with flat surfaces like cubes and cuboids will slide down a slope, but shapes with curved surfaces like balls and cylinders will roll down.

questions.question_text: You can pick up a cube and hold it, but you cannot pick up a square drawn on paper the same way.
questions.explanation_correct: You can pick up a cube because it is a 3D shape that takes up space. But you cannot pick up a square drawn on paper because it is a 2D shape that is flat and does not take up space.
questions.explanation_incorrect: The answer is not true because a square drawn on paper is a 2D shape, not a 3D shape. 2D shapes like squares and circles are flat and do not take up space, so you cannot pick them up and hold them like you can with 3D shapes like cubes.

questions.question_text: Put these shapes in order from the one that is most round to the one that is least round.
questions.explanation_correct: The sphere is the most round shape, followed by the cylinder, and then the cube is the least round shape. This is because the sphere is perfectly round, the cylinder has curved sides but flat ends, and the cube has flat sides and edges, making it the least round of the three.
questions.explanation_incorrect: The order from most round to least round is not Sphere, Cylinder, Cube. The sphere is the most round shape because it is perfectly round. The cylinder is the next most round shape because it has curved sides, although it has flat ends. The cube is the least round shape because it has flat sides and edges, making it the least round of the three shapes.

questions.question_text: Put these shapes in order from the one that rolls easiest to the one that does not roll at all.
questions.explanation_correct: The sphere rolls easiest because it has a curved surface and can easily roll around. The cylinder also has a curved surface and can roll, but not as easily as the sphere. The cuboid has flat surfaces and cannot roll at all, so it goes last in the order.
questions.explanation_incorrect: The cuboid would not roll at all because it has flat sides. The cylinder would roll better than the cuboid, but not as well as the sphere because the cylinder has a curved surface. The sphere is the best at rolling because it is perfectly round and has a curved surface that allows it to roll easily.

questions.question_text: Put these real objects in order from round to not round: marble, pipe, book.
questions.explanation_correct: The marble is the roundest object, so it goes first. The pipe is a bit less round than the marble, so it goes second. The book is not round at all, so it goes last. This order from most round to least round is correct.
questions.explanation_incorrect: The book is not round, so it should go last. The pipe is a bit round, so it should go in the middle. The marble is the most round, so it should go first. The correct order from most round to least round is: marble, pipe, book.

questions.question_text: Put these in order: first the flat (2D) shape, then its matching 3D shape. Circle, then ___.
questions.explanation_correct: The circle is a 2D flat shape, and the sphere is the matching 3D shape that is not flat. Spheres are round 3D shapes, like a ball, that can roll because they have curved surfaces.
questions.explanation_incorrect: The circle is a 2D flat shape, but the cube is not the matching 3D shape. Cubes have flat faces and cannot roll like spheres can. The matching 3D shape for a circle is a sphere, which is round and can roll.

questions.question_text: Put these 3D shapes in alphabetical order.
questions.explanation_correct: The 3D shapes are put in alphabetical order, which means they are arranged in the order of the letters of the alphabet. The order of the shapes from A to Z is: Cone, Cube, Cylinder, Sphere.
questions.explanation_incorrect: The 3D shapes are not in alphabetical order. The correct order from A to Z is: Cone, Cube, Cylinder, Sphere. This is because the letter 'C' comes before 'S', so Cone and Cube should be before Sphere. The order should also be Cone, Cube, Cylinder, and then Sphere.

questions.question_text: Put these objects in order from slides only to rolls easily: box, tin can, ball.
questions.explanation_correct: The box has flat faces, so it slides easily. The tin can has curved sides, so it can roll a little. The ball has a round shape, so it rolls easily.
questions.explanation_incorrect: The ball is the only object that can roll easily because it has a curved surface. The box and tin can have flat or curved sides, so they don't roll as easily as the ball.

questions.question_text: Put these in order: first the flat (2D) shape, then its matching 3D shape. Square, then ___.
questions.explanation_correct: The flat (2D) shape is a square, and the matching 3D shape is a cube. This is because a cube has six flat square faces, just like the 2D square shape.
questions.explanation_incorrect: The correct answer is a cube. This is because a cube is a 3D shape that has six flat square faces, just like the 2D square shape. The cube is the 3D version of the 2D square.

questions.question_text: What shape is Ball?
questions.explanation_correct: A ball is a sphere shape because it is round and rolls smoothly. The shape of a ball is a sphere, not a cone, cube, or cylinder.
questions.explanation_incorrect: A cone is a pointy 3D shape, like an ice cream cone. A cube is a 3D shape with 6 flat square faces, like a dice. A cylinder is a 3D shape that is round on the sides and flat on the top and bottom, like a tin can. But a ball is a sphere shape, which is round and can roll. So the correct answer is C) Sphere.

questions.question_text: What shape is Dice?
questions.explanation_correct: A dice is a cube shape. It has 6 flat faces and 12 straight edges, just like a cube. Dice are cubes because they are solid shapes with flat surfaces that can slide and not roll.
questions.explanation_incorrect: A sphere is a round ball shape, like a marble or a soccer ball. A cone is a pointy shape, like an ice cream cone. A cylinder is a round shape with flat tops, like a tin can. But a dice is a cube, which is a solid shape with 6 flat square faces. Cubes can slide and not roll, unlike a sphere or a cylinder.

questions.question_text: What shape is Tin can?
questions.explanation_correct: A tin can is a cylinder shape. Cylinders have a round curved surface on the sides and flat circular ends, just like a tin can. This matches the shape of a tin can, so the correct answer is A) Cylinder.
questions.explanation_incorrect: The other options are not the correct shape for a tin can. A cone has a round curved surface on the sides and a flat circular bottom, but the top is pointy. A sphere is a round ball shape. A cube is a square box shape with flat sides. None of these match the shape of a tin can, which is a cylinder.

questions.question_text: What shape is Ice cream cone?
questions.explanation_correct: An ice cream cone is a cone shape. It has a curved surface and a flat base, which are the features of a cone shape.
questions.explanation_incorrect: An ice cream cone is not a cylinder, cube, or sphere. A cylinder is a shape like a tin can, with a curved surface and two flat bases. A cube is a shape with six flat square faces. A sphere is a round shape like a ball. The ice cream cone is a cone shape, with a curved surface and one flat base.

questions.question_text: What shape is Sphere?
questions.explanation_correct: A sphere is a 3D shape that can roll because it has a curved surface. This means it can move around and not stay in one place.
questions.explanation_incorrect: A cube or cuboid is a 3D shape that slides because it has flat faces. It cannot roll around like a sphere can. A sphere is the 3D shape that can roll because of its curved surface.

questions.question_text: What shape is Cube?
questions.explanation_correct: The cube is a 3D shape that slides because it has flat faces, not curved surfaces like a ball or a tin can. Cubes can stay still on a flat surface without rolling away.
questions.explanation_incorrect: The cube is a 3D shape that slides, not rolls. This is because cubes have flat faces, unlike shapes like a ball or a tin can which have curved surfaces and can roll. Cubes stay in one place on a flat surface instead of moving around.

questions.question_text: What shape is Cylinder?
questions.explanation_correct: A cylinder rolls because it has curved surfaces, just like a ball. The curved surfaces let the cylinder roll smoothly on the ground.
questions.explanation_incorrect: A cylinder does not slide because it has flat faces like a cube or a box. Shapes that slide have flat faces that can move across a surface. Cylinders have curved surfaces, which is why they roll instead of slide.

questions.question_text: What shape is Cuboid?
questions.explanation_correct: Cuboid is a shape that slides because it has flat faces. It doesn't roll like a sphere or cylinder with curved surfaces.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Cuboid is a 3D shape that is not round like a ball or tin can. It has flat, rectangular faces that make it slide across a surface instead of rolling. So the correct answer is that cuboid slides, not rolls.

questions.question_text: What shape is Brick?
questions.explanation_correct: A brick is a cuboid shape, with flat faces, edges, and corners. This means it is a 3D shape that takes up space, unlike a 2D shape which is flat. A brick is not a cone, sphere, or cylinder.
questions.explanation_incorrect: A cone is a 3D shape that has a curved surface and a flat circular base. A sphere is a 3D shape that is round and curved all over, like a ball. A cylinder is a 3D shape that has two flat circular bases and a curved surface. But a brick is a cuboid shape, which has flat rectangular faces, edges, and corners.

questions.question_text: What shape is Orange?
questions.explanation_correct: An orange is a sphere shape, just like a ball. It is round and curved all over, without any flat sides. This makes it a sphere, which is one of the basic 3D shapes.
questions.explanation_incorrect: An orange is not a cuboid, cylinder, or cone shape. Those shapes have flat sides or pointed ends, but an orange is rounded all over like a ball. The orange is a sphere shape, which is a 3D shape that is curved and round like a ball.

questions.question_text: What shape is Party hat?
questions.explanation_correct: A party hat has a pointy top and a flat bottom, which is the shape of a cone. Cones are 3D shapes that have a circular base and a pointed top, just like a party hat.
questions.explanation_incorrect: A cylinder is a 3D shape that has two circular bases and a curved surface around the sides, like a tin can. A cuboid is a 3D shape with six flat rectangular faces, like a box. A sphere is a 3D shape that is perfectly round, like a ball. But a party hat is a cone, which is a 3D shape with a circular base and a pointy top.

questions.question_text: What shape is Drum?
questions.explanation_correct: A drum is a cylinder shape. It has a curved surface like a can or tin, which makes it a cylinder. Cylinders are one of the basic 3D shapes.
questions.explanation_incorrect: A drum is not a cuboid, sphere, or cone shape. Cuboids are rectangular shapes like bricks or boxes. Spheres are round shapes like balls. Cones have a curved surface and a flat bottom, like an ice cream cone. But a drum is a cylinder, which has a curved surface all around.

questions.question_text: What shape is Cube?
questions.explanation_correct: The cube is a 3D shape that has 6 square faces, 12 straight edges, and 8 vertices or corners. This makes it a cube, not a circle or a rectangle.
questions.explanation_incorrect: A circle is a 2D shape that is flat and has no depth. A cube is a 3D shape that takes up space and has 6 square faces, 12 straight edges, and 8 vertices or corners. The correct 3D shape is a cube, not a circle.

questions.question_text: What shape is Cylinder?
questions.explanation_correct: A cylinder is a 3D shape that looks like a tin can. It has a curved surface that can roll and two flat circular bases, so the correct answer is A) Circle.
questions.explanation_incorrect: A cylinder is not a rectangle or a square. Those are 2D shapes, but a cylinder is a 3D shape. A cylinder has a curved surface that can roll, unlike a rectangle or square which have flat sides that can only slide. The correct 3D shape for a cylinder is A) Circle.

questions.question_text: What shape is Cuboid?
questions.explanation_correct: A cuboid is a 3D shape that has rectangular faces, like a brick or a box. It has 6 flat faces, 12 edges, and 8 corners or vertices.
questions.explanation_incorrect: A cuboid is not a circle. A circle is a 2D shape that is round and flat. A cuboid is a 3D shape that has flat rectangular faces and looks like a box or a brick. The correct shape for a cuboid is a rectangle.

questions.question_text: What is the what it means of Face?
questions.explanation_correct: A face is the flat part of a 3D shape. A face is a flat surface, not a corner or a line. This means option A is the correct answer.
questions.explanation_incorrect: A vertex is the corner of a 3D shape, not the flat part. An edge is the line where two faces of a 3D shape meet. So options B and C are not the correct answer for what a face is.

questions.question_text: What is the what it means of Edge?
questions.explanation_correct: The edge of a 3D shape is the line where two flat faces meet. This is the correct answer because edges are the lines, not the corners (vertices) or the flat surfaces (faces) of the shape.
questions.explanation_incorrect: An edge is not the corner of a shape, which is called a vertex. And an edge is not the flat part of a shape, which is called a face. The edge is the line where two faces of the 3D shape meet, like the edges of a cube or a box.

questions.question_text: What is the what it means of Vertex?
questions.explanation_correct: The vertex of a 3D shape is the corner of the shape. This is where three or more faces of the shape meet.
questions.explanation_incorrect: A vertex is not a line where two faces meet, that is called an edge. And a vertex is not a flat part of the shape, that is called a face. The vertex is the corner of the 3D shape, where the edges and faces come together.

questions.question_text: What shape is Round like a ball?
questions.explanation_correct: The shape that is round like a ball is a sphere. A sphere is a 3D shape that is curved all around, just like a ball. It has no flat sides or corners.
questions.explanation_incorrect: A cuboid is a 3D shape that has flat sides and edges, not a curved round shape like a ball. A cube is also a 3D shape, but it has flat square sides, not a round shape. A cone has a curved side and a flat base, not a completely round shape. The shape that is round like a ball is a sphere.

questions.question_text: What shape is Pointed top, round base?
questions.explanation_correct: A cone has a pointed top and a round base, so the correct answer is B) Cone.
questions.explanation_incorrect: A cube is a shape with six flat, square faces and is not pointed at the top. A cuboid is a rectangular shape, and a sphere is a round shape. Only a cone has a pointed top and a round base, so the correct answer is B) Cone.

questions.question_text: What shape is All faces are equal squares?
questions.explanation_correct: The shape where all the faces are equal squares is a cube. A cube has 6 square faces that are all the same size, making it a 3D shape with equal sides.
questions.explanation_incorrect: A cuboid is a 3D shape like a brick or box, where the faces are rectangles of different sizes. A cone has one circular face and one pointy face, and a sphere is a round 3D shape like a ball. The correct answer is a cube, because a cube has 6 equal square faces.

questions.question_text: What shape is Box with rectangle faces?
questions.explanation_correct: A box with rectangle faces is called a cuboid. This is because a cuboid has six rectangular faces, unlike a cube which has six square faces.
questions.explanation_incorrect: A cube is a 3D shape with six square faces, like a dice. A sphere is a round 3D shape like a ball. A cone has a circular base and a pointy top, like an ice cream cone. The correct answer is a cuboid, which is a box-like shape with rectangle faces.

questions.question_text: What shape is Football?
questions.explanation_correct: A football is a sphere, or a round ball, because it has a curved surface that can roll. Spheres are one of the basic 3D shapes, along with cubes, cuboids, cones, and cylinders.
questions.explanation_incorrect: The football is not a cuboid, cylinder, or cone. These shapes have flat faces or a pointed end, but a football is round and curved like a sphere. Spheres are 3D shapes that can roll because they have a curved surface all around.

questions.question_text: What shape is Lunch box?
questions.explanation_correct: The lunch box is a cuboid shape, which is a 3D shape that looks like a rectangular box. It has flat faces, edges, and corners, just like a cube but with different dimensions.
questions.explanation_incorrect: The lunch box is not a cylinder, cone, or sphere. These 3D shapes have curved surfaces, while the lunch box has flat faces like a cuboid. A cuboid is a rectangular box shape, which is the correct shape for a lunch box.

questions.question_text: What shape is Candle?
questions.explanation_correct: A candle is a cylinder shape. It has a flat bottom, curved sides, and a flat top. Cylinders are 3D shapes that have two flat circular faces and a curved surface in between them, just like a candle.
questions.explanation_incorrect: A candle is not a cone shape. A cone has a flat circular base and a pointed top, like an ice cream cone. A candle has a flat top and bottom, with a curved surface in between, so it is a cylinder shape.

questions.question_text: What shape is Joker hat?
questions.explanation_correct: A Joker hat is shaped like a cone, which is one of the 5 basic 3D shapes. A cone has a curved surface and a flat base, just like a Joker hat.
questions.explanation_incorrect: The Joker hat is not a cuboid, cylinder, or sphere. A cuboid is a box-like shape, a cylinder is like a tin can, and a sphere is a round ball shape. The Joker hat is shaped like a cone, which has a curved surface and a flat base.

questions.question_text: What shape is Sphere?
questions.explanation_correct: A sphere has a curved surface, not flat faces. It is like a ball, which can roll because of its curved shape.
questions.explanation_incorrect: A sphere is not a shape with only flat faces. It has a curved surface, which is why it can roll around. Flat shapes like cubes and cuboids cannot roll because they have straight, flat faces.

questions.question_text: What shape is Cube?
questions.explanation_correct: The cube has only flat faces, which means all its sides are straight and not curved. This makes it a 3D shape with flat surfaces, unlike a sphere or cylinder which have curved surfaces.
questions.explanation_incorrect: The cube is not a shape with curved surfaces. It is a 3D shape made up of 6 flat square faces. The flat faces allow the cube to slide and not roll, unlike 3D shapes with curved surfaces like a ball or a tin can.

questions.question_text: What shape is Cone?
questions.explanation_correct: The cone has a curved surface, so the correct answer is A. A cone is a 3D shape with a curved base and a pointed top, like an ice cream cone.
questions.explanation_incorrect: The correct answer is A because a cone has a curved surface, not only flat faces. A cube or cuboid would have only flat faces, but a cone has a curved base and a pointed top, which makes it a 3D shape with a curved surface.

questions.question_text: What shape is Cuboid?
questions.explanation_correct: A cuboid has only flat faces, not curved surfaces. This is why the correct answer is A) Only flat faces.
questions.explanation_incorrect: A cuboid is a 3D shape that has flat faces, not a curved surface like a ball or can. The cuboid has six flat rectangular faces, like a brick or a box. So the correct answer is A) Only flat faces, not B) Curved surface.
